DataElement.preferredName: Chest Wall Malignant Neoplasm Invasion Skin Mastectomy Present Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator to evaluate the presence of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells invading the skin situated on either side of the chest following surgery to remove the breast (or as much of the breast tissue as possible).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chest Wall Malignant Neoplasm Invasion Skin Mastectomy Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells invading the skin situated on either side of the chest following surgery to remove the breast (or as much of the breast tissue as possible).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.

Concepts.definition: The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Invasion Skin Mastectomy Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.:1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:Surgical removal of the breast.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
